title: Quiz 5: Psychology & Personality
description: Test your knowledge of human psychology, Freud's personality theories, and defense mechanisms.

questions.question: Match Freud's personality component to its description:
questions.explanation: Id = Instincts; Ego = Reality; Super Ego = Morality.

questions.question: Which Ego Defense Mechanism involves ascribing one's own unacknowledged desires to others?
questions.explanation: Projection is 'projecting' your feelings onto someone else.
questions.hint: Like a movie projector throwing an image outward.

questions.question: According to Freud, the psychosexual stage from birth to age one, focused on the mouth, is the ___BLANK___ stage.
questions.explanation: The Oral stage is the first stage, focusing on feeding and oral stimulation.

questions.question: Which of the following are physical symptoms of anxiety? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Anxiety triggers the fight-or-flight response, increasing heart rate, BP, and muscle tension.

questions.question: Order Freud's Psychosexual Stages from earliest to latest:
questions.explanation: Order: Oral (0-1), Anal (1-3), Phallic (3-6), Latency (7-11), Genital (12+).

questions.question: What is the defense mechanism 'Sublimation'?

options.text: Diverting energy to socially acceptable activities
Acting opposite to how you feel

questions.explanation: Sublimation channels unacceptable impulses into productive, socially acceptable actions.
questions.hint: Turning bad energy into good work.

questions.question: Which type of coping strategy involves taking action to modify or avoid the threatening situation?
questions.explanation: Problem-focused coping targets the cause of stress directly. Emotion-focused targets the feelings.

questions.question: According to psychoanalytic theory, the 'Super Ego' is present at birth.
questions.explanation: The Id is present at birth. The Super Ego develops later as the child adopts social values.

questions.question: What is the term for the exclusion of impulses from conscious awareness?
questions.explanation: Repression is the unconscious blocking of unacceptable thoughts or impulses.

questions.question: Which stage involves the 'Oedipus complex' and identification with the same-sex parent?
questions.explanation: The Phallic stage (3-6 years) involves genital focus and the resolution of Oedipus/Electra complexes.
